intro: Hyptis paniculata, commonly known as blue hyptis, is a perennial herb native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Its ornamental value also makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
